data.title: Saturday Morning Television Show to Highlight WVSU Athletics
data.meta_description: A new era in West Virginia State University athletics will launch this fall with the premiere of "The Yellow Jacket Nation" television show on at 9 a.m. Saturday,
data.text:
A new era in West Virginia State University athletics will launch this fall with the premiere of "The Yellow Jacket Nation" television show on at 9 a.m. Saturday, September 2.

Broadcast weekly on WVAH-Fox 11, "The Yellow Jacket Nation" will highlight the student-athletes, coaches, game events, game results, game highlights, statistics, as well as other noteworthy events in the life of athletic department of WVSU.

Well-known West Virginia sports broadcaster and writer Frank Giardina will serve as host.

"'The Yellow Jacket Nation' will provide a broader audience more detailed information about not only our sports programs, but some of the inspiring stories of our student-athletes," said WVSU President Anthony L. Jenkins. "We are proud to bring this sports programming to our fans who are loyal members of The Yellow Jacket Nation."

The 30-minute program will air for 23 weeks throughout the fall and winter months.

"We are extremely excited for the opportunity to increase the visibility of our Athletic Department and showcase our student-athletes through 'The Yellow Jacket Nation,'" said WVSU Athletic Director Nathan Burton. "I believe our fans and supporters are really going to enjoy seeing inside Yellow Jacket Athletics."

WVSU is working with the advertising and marketing firm, The Barnes Agency, in the development of "The Yellow Jacket Nation."
